meanings.definition: To shake or tremble as if about to fall
meanings.sent1: The old man was tottering on the edge of the cliff.
meanings.sent2: The toddler was tottering as he tried to walk on his own.
meanings.sent3: The stack of books looked like it was tottering on the wobbly table.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was tottering after receiving the bad news.
meanings.sent5: The tower of blocks was tottering precariously before it finally collapsed.

meanings.definition: Unsteady or shaky in movement or balance
meanings.sent1: The tottering puppy struggled to keep its balance on the slippery floor.
meanings.sent2: The tottering old bridge creaked under the weight of the passing cars.
meanings.sent3: The tottering stack of plates threatened to fall with the slightest touch.
meanings.sent4: Her tottering voice betrayed her nervousness during the speech.
meanings.sent5: The tottering tree swayed dangerously in the strong wind.

meanings.definition: To be on the brink of collapse or failure
meanings.sent1: The company was tottering on the edge of bankruptcy.
meanings.sent2: His health was tottering after years of neglect.
meanings.sent3: The tottering project needed a miracle to succeed.
meanings.sent4: Their relationship was tottering, but they were trying to save it.
meanings.sent5: The tottering empire was facing rebellion from its subjects.
